item.title: Does Steven Spielberg really beat Tim Burton in IMDB ratings?
item.description: Load Libraries ## ── Attaching packages ───────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.0 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.3.2 ✓ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✓ tibble 3.0.3 ✓ dplyr 1.0.2 ## ✓ tidyr 1.1.2 ✓ stringr 1.4.0 ## ✓ readr 1.3.1 ✓ forcats 0.5.0 ## ── Conflicts ──────────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() ## Registered S3 method overwritten by 'mosaic': ## method from ## fortify.SpatialPolygonsDataFrame ggplot2 ## ## The 'mosaic' package masks several functions from core packages in order to add ## additional features.

item.title: The social media trap
item.description: General Social Survey (GSS) The General Social Survey (GSS) gathers data on American society in order to monitor and explain trends in attitudes, behaviours, and attributes. Many trends have been tracked for decades, so one can see the evolution of attitudes, etc in American Society. In this section, we analyze data from the 2016 GSS sample data, using it to estimate values of population parameters of interest about US adults.

item.title: Your people matter
item.description: IBM HR Analytics We will analyze a data set on Human Resource Analytics. The IBM HR Analytics Employee Attrition & Performance data set is a fictional data set created by IBM data scientists. Among other things, the data set includes employees’ income, their distance from work, their position in the company, their level of education, etc. A full description can be found on the website. Load Data First, we load the data.

item.title: Financial Stocks
item.description: Returns of financial stocks I will use the tidyquant package to download historical data of stock prices, calculate returns, and examine the distribution of returns. I will first identify which stocks we want to download data for, and for this we must know their ticker symbol; Apple is known as AAPL, Microsoft as MSFT, McDonald’s as MCD, etc. The file nyse.csv contains 508 stocks listed on the NYSE, their ticker symbol, name, the IPO (Initial Public Offering) year, and the sector and industry the company is in.
